context: National health system, 500000 employees, evaluating population-wide genomic screening for preventive care

request.purpose: Implement national genomic screening program for preventive disease detection
request.justification: Genomic screening offers 30% reduction in disease incidence and €2B annual healthcare cost savings through prevention

decision_process.outcome: Strong clinical evidence supporting preventive screening benefits
Comprehensive privacy and ethical framework with public consultation
Feasible implementation with phased rollout strategy
Strong public support with 70% approval rating
Approved with enhanced privacy protections and evaluation framework

business_impact.health_outcomes: 30% reduction in preventable diseases and improved population health metrics
business_impact.economic_benefits: €2B annual savings in healthcare costs through early intervention
business_impact.preventive_focus: Shift from treatment to prevention with long-term sustainability benefits
business_impact.innovation_ecosystem: Development of domestic genomics industry and research capabilities

decision_outcome: Approved €500M program with 5-year implementation timeline; includes voluntary opt-in model, comprehensive privacy framework, and independent evaluation committee to monitor clinical outcomes and cost effectiveness
